title: Badenoch defends Jenrick over comments that he ‘did not see another white face’ in Birmingham – UK politics live
summary: The Conservative leader has indicated that comments attributed to him in a Guardian report may have been taken out of context. He clarified that he was merely ‘making an observation.’ The remarks have sparked some controversy and debate.

title: JLR to restart some manufacturing operations on Wednesday; Ineos claims UK ‘sleepwalking into deindustrialisation’ – business live
summary: Jaguar Land Rover is set to resume manufacturing operations while introducing a new faster payment scheme for suppliers. This initiative aims to improve cash flow and support the supply chain. The move reflects the company's commitment to enhancing relationships with its suppliers.

title: French PM in final bid to salvage cabinet amid political turmoil – Europe live
summary: French President Macron has requested Minister Lecornu to remain in his position for an additional 48 hours. The aim is to persuade lawmakers to support upcoming initiatives. This move highlights the government's efforts to ensure parliamentary backing amidst political challenges.

title: Badenoch defends Jenrick’s ‘no white faces in Birmingham’ comments
summary: The Tory leader defended comments made by Robert Jenrick, who described Handsworth as "one of the worst integrated places I've ever been to." The leader stated that there is "nothing wrong with making observations." This response follows criticism over Jenrick's statement regarding the area's integration issues.

title: Gaza ceasefire talks live: negotiations to continue as Israelis mark two-year anniversary of 7 October attacks
summary: The initial day of negotiations between Hamas and mediators in Egypt concluded positively, according to local media. The discussions focused on the situation in Gaza. Both parties reportedly engaged in constructive dialogue.
